meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny!

It's time to get this Octopath party started! As I dive into the world of Square Enix's latest JRPG masterpiece, I'm reminded of the good ol' days when pixel art reigned supreme and turn-based combat was the name of the game.

But let's not just stop at nostalgia; we're here to talk about the real deal – how Octopath Traveler stacks up against the competition. Now, I know what you're thinking: "What do all these fancy review scores mean?" Well, buckle up, folks, because I'm about to give you the lowdown on the most important one – the gameplay!

Now, let's start with what makes Octopath stand out: its battle system. Imagine a perfectly blended cocktail of Chrono Trigger and Final Fantasy VI, with a dash of modern flair. Yeah, it's that good! The addition of "Break" and "Boost" abilities adds a whole new layer of strategy to the combat, making each encounter feel fresh and exciting.

Of course, no JRPG would be complete without an epic soundtrack, and Octopath delivers in spades. Composer Yoko Shimomura has outdone herself with this one – you'll find yourself humming the tunes long after you've stopped playing. And let's not forget about the visuals! The pixel art is nothing short of stunning, with each character's design paying loving tribute to the classics.

Now, I know some critics might say that the storytelling is a bit wonky (hey, IGN and GameSpot, I'm looking at you!). But honestly, who cares when the combat is this good? Each character's journey is unique and engaging in its own way, even if they don't always intersect neatly. And hey, who doesn't love exploring side areas and battling optional bosses?

All joking aside, Octopath Traveler is a true masterpiece that will keep you hooked for hours on end. So what are you waiting for? Get ready to travel the world (or at least, the pixelated world) with eight charming characters, each with their own story to tell.

So, what's my final verdict? Well, let's just say that Octopath Traveler has won me over in a big way – and I'm not alone! The majority of critics agree that this game is a must-play for anyone who loves JRPGs. So go ahead, give it a try, and see if you can resist the charm of this retro-modern gem!

Hippo out!
